*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Elias R. Wightman, May 17, 1830. Surveying, Indians, land grants.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Dr Sir. I recd your letter by the *p*indian */p*and am much, pleased with your account of the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and progress in surveying— It will be impossible for me to visit there for I shall leave here for *location_mentioned*St Antonio*/location_mentioned* in a few days—*/p*
*p*you will therefore exercise your own judgement in laying off that *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*so that there be no vacancies left and you will regulate the shape of the tracts as situations and circumstances may require and also intermix *location_mentioned*quarters */location_mentioned*where necessary to fill vacancies and above- all make all the *location_mentioned*tracts */location_mentioned*you can, and economise the water fronts as much as possible so as to make as many tracts as possible I must rely on your judgement and give you discretionary powers in this matter which I do without hesitation and with the most entire confidence*/p*
*p*I wish you to select *location_mentioned*two leagues*/location_mentioned* there for me as a part of my *location_mentioned*premium land*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*I have given your letter to *person_mentioned*Mr. Williams*/person_mentioned* to make the entries you mention—*/p*
*p*Keep harmony with the *person_mentioned*Beedies */person_mentioned*and enjoin it on the *person_mentioned*Settlers */person_mentioned*to do the same and to treat them well and try and persuade them to settle on the *p*East side of the San Jacinto*/p**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="05-17-1830">May 17. 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*E. R. Weightman*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
